positive_examples: This is an example of comprehension axiom.
The comprehension axiom demonstrated clear characteristics.
We observed comprehension axiom in this context.
A typical case of comprehension axiom would involve these features.
The concept of comprehension axiom applies here.
The logical principle that allows the formation of sets based on specified properties or conditions.
negative_examples: This is an example of superposition principle, not comprehension axiom.
The document was filed in the cabinet.
She walked to the store to buy groceries.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: SuperpositionPrinciple, or other types of Axiom

definition: An axiom allowing set construction by specifying a property that members satisfy.
